page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO WOOTTON
page.content: Our study area was{Wootton,}in the north east of the{Isle of Wight.}The main land cover in the area is fields but there is also a large area of houses and of woodland. There are two holiday camps in the area called,{Woodside Bay and Little {Canada.}The main{Car Ferry terminal for the Isle of Wight is also situated in Wootton, these ferries also carry lorries and coaches. The main activities are farming and forestry. The farming is mainly livestock farming especially dairy cattle. The forests are owned both privately and by the{National Trust and the{Forestry Commision. A lot of new housing development has taken place in this area during the past decade around Wootton Bridge and to a lesser extent in Havenstreet.
